Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Recently \Re"cent*ly\ (r[=e]"sent*l[y^]), adv. Newly; lately; freshly; not long since; as, advices recently received. [1913 Webster]

recently adv 1: in the recent past; "he was in Paris recently"; "lately the rules have been enforced"; "as late as yesterday she was fine"; "feeling better of late"; "the spelling was first affected, but latterly the meaning also" [syn: {late}, {lately}, {of late}, {latterly}] 2: very recently; "they are newly married"; "newly raised objections"; "a newly arranged hairdo"; "grass new washed by the rain"; "a freshly cleaned floor"; "we are fresh out of tomatoes" [syn: {newly}, {freshly}, {fresh}, {new}]
